newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ govt withdraws funding for Aotearoa Television.
newsitem.headline: NZ govt withdraws funding for Aotearoa Television.

text.p: The New Zealand government will withdraw the NZ$4 million funding set aside for Maori station Aotearoa Television (ATN), Radio New Zealand reported on Monday.
The cabinet reversed its decision of a fortnight ago, and decided to end the contract with Aotearoa TV, Radio New Zealand reported.

The four million dollars of public funding will not now be handed over. A review by the Ministry of Commerce has raised concerns about the financial controls in place at the TV station, and Aotearoa's ability to meet the requirements of a renewed contract, it said.
The station's previous funding contract ended on Waitangi Day, but at this stage it's still broadcasting.
The cabinet decision follows widespread publicity about spending on clothes by two ATN directors, property deals, and the board of directors' lack of management of the station.
Earlier, the government put on hold the planned $4 million injection, pending Commerce Ministry, Serious Fraud Office and other inquiries into the station's finances.
